message.content:
cs.MM, cs.GR, cs.NI, cs.CV, cs.IT 

The paper deals with streaming 360 videos, which involves multimedia processing (cs.MM) and graphics (cs.GR) to provide an immersive experience. The authors also mention the limited bandwidth and the need to optimize the data transmission, which falls under networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The proposed approach involves tiling the video and streaming the tiles currently being viewed, which requires computer vision and image processing techniques (cs.CV). Finally, the authors mention minimizing storage requirements at the server side, which involves information theory (cs.IT).
